(Translated by Google) Perpect  (Original) Perpect

the food is high priced but good we went there for lunch it was beautiful so we went with a few friends for dinner we made reservations we got there at 6:00 PM the place was half empty we sat down, ordered and waited more than 45 minutes for appetizer and then additional 60 minutes for main course which came after 8:00 PM needless to say the service was bad and they had the Chutzpa to charge 18% TIP we recommend lunch as it is buffet style but not dinner as the kitchen can not handle individual orders

Drove into Brooklyn from Montreal. We had a bad experience on our first day at another restaurant. So I looked up online and found this Orchidea on 12th ave with good reviews. Decided to try it. Walked in a few minutes after opening. Right away very courteous and warm service. As we walked in it looked like when you stay at a fancy Hotel in Jerusalem and walk down to a continental breakfast. Very clean, colours of the decor were soft and pleasing.  They were having a buffet, but the waiter said we could order anything else. We went for the buffet. He asked if I wanted something to drink and some bread. Yes to both. Coffee and a large roll arrived quickly.  They had 3 types of salads, sushi, baked Salmon, fried eggplant with cheese, pasta with cheese, borekas, soup and desert.  I tried a little of everything and they were all done excellent. The buffet presentation was nice clean, the service was great. This is the first time that I have seen a kosher restaurant have 2 ingredients that are always missing; good food and good service.  To the staff keep up the good work, and to the owner you should be proud to run such an establishment.
Went out last night for my second time to this place. Highly recommended for a lovely evening, the Chef specials are always great and their fish dishes are unreal.

User Name : Myra 5/11/13 Subject : Orchidea Message : Last night my husband Jeff and I hosted a Sheva Brachos dinner for our niece and her new husband. We live in the Boston area and had to arrange for this from out of town, over the phone. We did not have unlimited funds but wanted to make a lovely celebration. Ofer and Mazal were so helpful, caring and creative! I knew it would be a nice affair, but when we walked into the restaurant last night, the gorgeous table they had set took our breath away. Beautiful, elegant, sophisticated, but not overdone, it was simply stunning. They even produced the fixed menu on the inside of a beautiful folded card they created with a pretty design and the names of the bride and groom on the front. There was one at each place setting. The service was friendly, professional and attentive. The entire dinner was absolutely delicious!! We started with caesar salad which was tastier than I've had in any Italian restaurant, then came vegetable soup; li ght and flavorful, followed by tilapia with a light almond cream sauce, fresh vegetables and garlic potatoes, all artfully presented and delicious at the same time. The desserts were simply to die for!! Tiramisu in a chocolate cup and Neopolitan pastry that melted in your mouth. To top it all off, Ofer and Mazal made us all so comfortable, even accommodating our son's desire for a different entree when we could not convince him to try the fish or the penne pasta with vodka sauce. i can't recommend this establishment highly enough, and can't wait for our next trip to Brooklyn and dinner at Orchidea!
Everything at Orchidea is amazing. Wonderful food and wonderful service. A great breath of fresh air in congested Brooklyn, New York. Its kosher too!

We held a party here on a sunday afternoon, with guests from Connecticut to Pennsylvania.  The food, the presentation, the staff, and the restaurant itself were all perfect.  Each dish was a masterpiece of both art and flavor.  And the desserts were on par with any patisserie. Ofer was wonderful throughout the planning process.  Even when he called the night before the party to ask the number of guests, he didn't get upset when I said, "45 said yes and 10 didn't respond."  He simply said he'd set up for 45 and leave two extra tables available for people who just show up.  He arranged for special chairs that could squeeze in a few more than the room normally is set up for, and went all out to make sure we were taken care of beyond expectations.
Great place, great atmosphere! and good food.  Very high class place. I was there for my first date with my future wife and will go again to celebrate our 1 year "university" :)  Recommended.
